title_en: Trade unions call for a sanitary strike in Andalusia on June 26
summary_en:
Trade unions are calling for a sanitary strike in Andalusia on June 26.
The strike is being held in protest against the dismissal of 5,000 specialists and the lack of negotiating capacity.
The problems of the Junta of Andalusia are related to overcrowded waiting lists, the collapse of the primary health care system and staff cuts.
Four unions announced a partial shutdown of all SAS centers and services from 8 a.m. to 11 a.m.
Trade unions condemn the non-compliance with the agreement in the field of primary health care and the dismissal of staff.
Downsizing is one of the main reasons for supporting the strike.
The lack of forecasting and a clear policy became the reasons for the strike.
The Council on the pact in the field of primary health care was signed just over a year ago, but the supervisory board met only once.
The Ministry of Health is struggling with reducing the waiting lists for surgical intervention of patients.

title_en: Labor: a warning strike by port workers in Emden on Friday
summary_en:
The Verdi trade union has called on workers at the Emden seaport to declare a precautionary strike on Friday morning.
The strike is scheduled to begin at 6:00 a.m. and last until noon.
This is the fourth such action within the framework of this round of tariffs.
The employers, the Central Association of German Port Companies (ZDS), have not yet submitted proposals for discussion.
The second round of negotiations will take place on June 6, but June did not lead to a result.
The next round of negotiations is scheduled for June 17 and 18.
Verdi demands an increase in hourly wages by three euros from June 1 and a corresponding increase in shift allowances.
ZDS understood this, but did not take it into account sufficiently in its proposal.
It is necessary to reduce the wage gap between different groups.

title: –ü—Ä–æ—Ñ—Å–æ—é–∑—ã –ø—Ä–∏–∑—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç –∫ –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–µ SAS 26 –∏—é–Ω—è, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã "–≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω–∏—Ç—å —Ç–æ, —á—Ç–æ —É–∂–µ –ø–æ–¥–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–æ".
title_en: The unions are calling for an SAS strike on June 26 to "fulfill what has already been signed."
summary_en:
The Working Commissions, UGT, SATSE and CSIF have announced a call for a partial shutdown of the Andalusian Health Service.
Non-fulfillment of agreements, layoffs of employees and suspension of the work of the Labor Exchange are the reasons for the strike.
This is a "historic" strike, which was agreed to by "four majority unions representing 80% of the sector."
The mobilization began due to the delay in the implementation of the agreement on primary health care.
Three lists of people who have not been given a professional career are under consideration.
The suspension of the work of the labor exchange causes problems, since contracts were not concluded on time.
The unions have asked to talk to the one who makes political decisions to solve the problems.
